title: Sector Rotation Sends Technology Stocks Lower And Banks Higher
text:
It was a rather dull day on Monday with the finishing the day flat. However, underneath the surface, there was some sector rotation that was taking place. It sent the and stocks higher, and lower.

Based on the movement in yield and , the rotation seems rational and somewhat logical. The big question is if it will last? That part I’m not sure at this point. One day doesn’t make a trend, but I do not happen to think that oil and yields can continue to rise a bit more.

S&P 500 (SPY)

S&P 500 Index

The good news is that the index is holding support around 2975. Nothing in my outlook has changed.

Russell (IWM)

Russell 2000 Index Chart

The had a great day, rising by over 1% today, and is attempting to clear resistance at 1,521. I think that is positive and that 1,536 is likely next.

Roku (ROKU)

Roku Inc Daily Chart

Is the Roku (NASDAQ: ) bubble popping? It certainly seems possible. The stock’s valuation makes Netflix (NASDAQ: ) look cheap. But at this point, you can see that the uptrend is still intact. However, should the stock drop below $155 then perhaps it sends the $100. But $155 is the level to watch.

Freeport (FCX)

Freeport-McMoran Copper & Gold (NYSE: ) jumped today, and the next level to watch for is $9.90.

Freeport Inc Daily Chart

Lululemon (LULU)

Lululemon Athletica (NASDAQ: ) was down today after last week’s significant gains. But for now, it holds support at $195. However, a break of support will send shares towards $189.

Lululemon Inc Daily Chart

Apple (AAPL)

Apple (NASDAQ: ) got close to failed at resistance around $217. I saw bearish options betting in the stock. It has me thinking that perhaps the stocks run may cool some. $209.50 is the next level of support.

Apple Inc Daily Chart

NXP (NXPI)

NXP (NASDAQ: ) looks as if it may have broken out rise above $106. We have been waiting for this for some time. But perhaps it finally sticks with a move to $115 possible.

NXPI Daily Chart

Original Post
description: Stocks Analysis by Michael Kramer covering: S&P 500, Apple Inc, Freeport-McMoran Copper & Gold Inc, Crude Oil WTI Futures. Read Michael Kramer's latest article on Investing.com
